bibl.title: Military Orders for Alexander N. Stark, February 5, 1901 [selected page]

div1.p: Special Orders #27 elects Stark to a board of officers. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Military Orders for Alexander N. Stark, February 5, 1901 [selected page]
div1.p:
HEADQUARTERS DEPARTMENT OF CUBA,
Havana, February 5, 1901.

1. The journey performed by Captain Walter B. Barker,
Assistant Quartermaster, U. S. Volunteers, from Cienfue-
gos to Santa Clara, Cuba, and return, on January 30, 1901,
in connection with a strike on the part of the laborers there,
is approved and made of record as having been necessary
for the public service.

2. By direction of the Secretary of War, a board of offi-
cers, to consist of:
Major Alexander N. Stark, Surgeon, U. S. Volunteers;

1st Lieutenant William N. Bispham, Medical Depart-
ment, U. S. Army;

1st Lieutenant William T. Littebrant, 7th Cavalry, Re-
corder;

will convene at Columbia Barracks, Cuba, February 7, 1901,
or as soon thereafter as practicable, for the examination of
such enlisted men of the Army as may be ordered before it,
to determine their fitness for appointment as 2d Lieuten-
ant, U. S. Army.

The examination will be conducted as provided for in
General Orders No. 79, series of 1892, as modified by Gen-
eral Orders No. 32 and 148, series of 1899, Headquarters of
the Army, with the exception that the term of service
therein provided for is reduced so as to require only one
year of service by the candidate.

Upon completion of their duties, such members of the
board as are not stationed at Columbia Barracks will return
to their proper stations.

Such journeys as may be required of the members be-
tween their proper stations and Columbia Barracks and re-
turn in attending the meetings of the board are necessary
for the public service.

3. By direction of the Secretary of War, a board of
officers, to consist of:
